Reviews.Title: “Small but perfect”
Reviews.Author: jjmee
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights and on first entering the room thought it quite small but it was bright and very clean. It served its purpose very well providing cheap clean comfortable accom. The only draw back was there were no tea making facilities at first this doesn't seem a problem but every time you want a cup of tea you have to go out to a cafe which starts to get expensive. There was however a cafe on the next block which was run by a very friendly family who served excellent tea/coffee and good inexpensive meals ( eating out in Barcelona can get very expensive). There was very little noise in the Hotel despite it being fully booked so each night had a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, inexpensive, clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: loron
Reviews.Content: The Transit Hotel is a short walk from the Barcelona Sants Station. From the outside it looks fairly nondescript and the entry foyer could do with some TLC. We were wondering what to expect and on entering the Hotel decided that we couldn't expect much. We were pleasantly surprised when we opened the door to our room on the ground floor at the back of the hotel. The room was spacious, clean, with a large comfortable bed, was well equipped and because it was on the ground floor the bathroom had been renovated to enable a person in a wheelchair to access it easily. There was a reverse cycle air conditioner in the room because the window could not be opened, and this provided us with cool air when needed. For the price, we think we had an excellent room in a Hotel with 24 hour reception, in a very convenient yet quiet location. Reception staff at the hotel were helpful and friendly. All of them spoke English. Two doors down from the hotel was a very popular cafe/bar/restaurant that offered coffee and croisants for 2 euros or omelette, coffee and toast for 2 euros 65 cents. We made use of this very friendly establishment because the hotel did not provide breakfast. Across the road from the cafe was an internet outlet that charged 1 euro for one hour of internet use. As we used the internet for only 30 minutes, we were charged 50 cents for the privilege. Between the railway station and the hotel is a very large supermarket that provided everything from groceries to hardware to clothing. The popular tourist hop on hop off sightseeing buses stop at "Sants".

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, small room”
Reviews.Author: L-i-Y-i-A
Reviews.Content: I went there when they were renovating. I had to walk through the painting area to get into my room the lift was so small that it was almost full from our big luggage. I got the room that I had to carry my luggage on the steps to the room (after getting out of the lift) The room looked new (I guess it was already renovated), but it was very small.

Reviews.Title: “Crap!”
Reviews.Author: Nadroig
Reviews.Content: Like sleeping inside a shoebox... Terrible service, noises, smelly bathrooms... Como dormir en una caja de zapatos... Pésimo servicio, ruidos, baños hediondos...

Reviews.Title: “Near to Sants Station”
Reviews.Author: Volcanoking
Reviews.Content: Room is small and the wash rooms are also small. They have a very good shower and airconditioner in the room. No internet facility at the entire hotel. Hotel is very near to Barcelona Sants station. No food. They have some coffee vending machines. They are renovating the hotel. So, rooms seems to be very fresh. Had good sleep and great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location newly renovated but had damp in the walls”
Reviews.Author: Donnellap
Reviews.Content: This was in a great location and we stayed on the gound floor no.2 newly renovated. But had damp in the walls and smelt a bit in the room - but overall it was great. Very basic, no internet, but near all amenities. In fact I would say a bit pricey for what it was. Good service.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Hormuz
Reviews.Content: My first impression, on entering the single room of the hotel, was one of utter disbelief. It was just large enough to hold a small single bed, a wardrobe and a small chair - not an armchair. The attached toilet and bathtub were just adequate for mis-shapen dwarfs. It was one of the most basic hotels I had ever stayed in during my 50 years of travel. The air-conditioning occasionally produced some very loud and most worrisome noises. Despite repeated complaints, the staff were unhelpful.Since the small and very old TV receiver did not respond to the remote unit, I complained about it. A man came over to check. He informed me that it could only be started by pressing the button on the receiver, and not remotely. That TV switch was almost a foot beyond my tip-toe reach. Result: No TV for 7 nights. Thereafter, I did not even bother to complain - though there was a lot to complain about. The blanket had been cut and slashed by some previous disgrunted guest - and had not been replaced. Small patches of paint had pealed from the sidewall and ceiling. There were large black ants in the basin and toilet, though the room staff took care of them after the second day. There was no bath mat and not even a soap holder with the bathtub. The wardrobe door would not shut tight. It was a bare-bones hotel witrh the barest min9imum of facilities. It had also been difficult to locate on the first day. Considering these points, and the fact that no breakfast was offered, The charge of Euro 54 a night was truly extortionate. GTA Travelport, through whom my travel agent had booked my hotel, owes to its customers to ensure that the hotels offered represent good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “much better then we expected”
Reviews.Author: Jitka_10
Reviews.Content: We were bit nervous after reading some negative rewiews, but we stayed 5 nights in clean brand new room (though wery small), with perfectly working AC, TV, window, very comfy bed... The bathroom looked new as well, absolutely clean, no traces of bad smell. We heard neibourghs once or twice as the walls are really thin, but we spent a minimum time there (as probably most people coming there). So if you want cheap accomodation to pass the nights, Transit Hotel is perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “simple but functional”
Reviews.Author: daftdave
Reviews.Content: i had no problems with this hotel.yes its small and basic,but for what you are paying you are getting value for money.the rooms are small,yet have everything you need including proper air conditioning,working shower,loo and a tv. beds and linen were clean.you are close to good places to eat and drink,the metro is nearby and the palace and fountains is a 10 min stroll.if you are wanting to stay in the height of comfort with all the modern day essentials then sure,give this place a miss. but ifu r back packing,working on a budget or passing through(as we were) then this place fits the bill and if i follow the same plans next year will have no issues staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Godd value for money”
Reviews.Author: dell99
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for somewhere cheap and basic this is an excellent place to stay. it has a really good location near two metro stops, there is a lovely little place for breakfast just next door and the staff are really helpful. the rooms are small but clean. basically you get what you pay for

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL TRANCID”
Reviews.Author: the_travellin_man
Reviews.Content: GIMME A D GIMME A U GIMME A M GIMME A P What does it spell? DUMP bed linen had holes, white towels were tatty and greyed (read old, need to use as floor rags) Shower head would not hold direction Prices were ridiculously increased due to exhibition up the road. I could hear the next room's TV I could hear the next room using the toilet No internet access even though the wireless router is in full view at reception. Phone was grubby. Don’t bother there are cheaper and prettier places to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but very clean, all staff helpful and very central for local metro network.”
Reviews.Author: goobearyorkshire
Reviews.Content: Get a pass for underground very cheap and great to get around. Decent chinese restaurant round the corner near tarragona underground. As another reviewer said Italian round the corner was a rip off. Nice bars on stations for a good beer and a sarnie for lunch when you are out and about.( we found a friendly and spotlessly clean one at passage de Gracia down one of the walkways) .Well worth the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & cheerful”
Reviews.Author: laura2583
Reviews.Content: What you pay for, is what you get!! I paid £100 for 3 nights for my husband and myself and it was definitely worth no more than £100!! The location is good and very central. Two minute walk from Barcelo Sants train station and 5 minute walk to Tarragona metro station. When we first arrived we were shown to room 109, but when we got into room we noticed that the lock on the window had been tampered with and you could gain access onto roof and therefore into room. We asked to change due to security reasons and we were moved without hesitation to room 406. Overall, the rooms are small and the shower has little power, with either scalding water or freezing water. The rooms are paper thin and you can hear every noise, alot of broken sleep!! I dont think I would stay here again due to the discomfort of it but it is a great location for sightseeing Barcelona. I would also say that it is very expensive in Barcelona and I found the choice of food very poor. All i ate for lunch and dinner was pizza or baguettes. They offer alot of seafood but if you are not a lover of seafood like me then you are limited to what you buy!! The cost of beers vary enormously. We found a local cafe bar near the hotel which was 1.60 euros for a bottle of estrella but 2 doors down in the pizza place it was 4 euros for a pint!! Overall, I enjoyed my stay in Barcelona and loved visiting all the great sights, however I would not stay in this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: caulfieldScotland
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel, 20 minutes from the airport metres from Sants railway station with bars etc close by. If you like to spend a lot of time in your room (and why would you in a city like Barcelona?) then its probably not for you but it is clean and represents true value for money.

Reviews.Title: “loved the location”
Reviews.Author: jeremy62
Reviews.Content: we have just come back from barcelona, staying at the transit hotel. for the money, it was brilliant. a working shower, good air con, clean towels and sheets changed every day. the location was brilliant, close to the main train station and to the metro. the staff were very helpful and very polite. we wouldnt hesitate to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Should not be called a hotel”
Reviews.Author: fil2003uk
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks very nice when you first walk in. The receptionist was very grumpy and unwelcoming, i felt like i was getting interrogated. Once i recieved my key i made it up the marble staircase on the groundfloor and after which turned into old battered concrete. The lighting was terrible and the hallways were about a doorways width. This gave an impression of some sort of squatters accomodation. After finding my room and opening the door the quality of the room matched the quality of the hallway. The bedding looked about 10 years old and was terribly creaky. There was a sink in the room as it would not fit in the place that was meant to be a bathroom. This was a tiny cubicle with a toilet and shower squashed in, again very low quality. The one towel provided was the size of a tea towel. The room had a very small window with a very nice view of a big air vent. There was a very unpleasent and unrelaxing vibe to this hotel and therefore i was forced to check out early and find other accomodation in which for the same price i found a proper hotel in a better location. i would not recommend this hotel to anyone as it is very decieving and better accomodation can be found for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: EssexSazza
Reviews.Content: The last review from the person who stayed in January i cannot believe. My friend and i booked the Hotel Transit last minute because it was so cheap and when we arrived with fears applenty we were pleasantly surprised. The reception staff spoke good english, the room was clean and tidy and the bathroom was also very clean. Our bed linen, towels and soaps etc were changed promptly each day and you could not fault this hotel for its location and service. As for the rooms being too small there were two single beds in the room (with very good linen...not threadbare sheets!) and a small wardrobe (no sink in our room!), and the bathroomhad a sink, bedae, bath with a shower in it (no holes in the shower curtain either!).

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: mark_181
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at this hotel our first impression was that it would be fine. The reception area was clean and nicely presented. This was only covering up for the terrible conditions of the rooms. For a start the room which we were given was very, very small. The floor looked as if it hadn't been cleaned in weeks. The bed-sheets were so old that they were threadbare and you could shake the dust off the musty old curtain on the window. The toilet area was so small that there was only room for a half-sized bath and the toilet, which when you were using your knees could touch the door. The sink area was in the room not in the toilet itself. There was also a hole in the shower curtain. We went back down to reception and enquired if there was any better room given the state of the one we initially got. At which point we were informed that this was the best room that they had and that every other room was smaller. To this end we promptly checked out, as we couldn't possibly face a night staying there. Even though we are not fussy guests and have stayed in some poor quality hotels in the past on our travels, this was easily the worst of them all and i would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: NSWgirl
Reviews.Content: Basically, dont stay at this hotel. It is a dump. Rooms are small, old and have a very stuffy smell. The bathrooms are very old and our shower curtain had a huge hole in it. We only stayed here one night and found a much nicer hotel around the corner called Hotel Expo. This hotel was a four star hotel, absolutely beautiful, huge rooms with gorgeous, modern bathroom. There is a lovely roof top pool with great views of Barcelona. A roof top bar and cafe. The price of this hotel was exactly the same as the Transit Hotel. Transit Hotel is a total, total rip off and the staff at the counter are not interested in their customers at all. Do not stay at this hotel. Go straight to the Hotel Expo for some luxury!

HotelInfo.Address: Rector Triado 82, 08014 Barcelona, Spain
